page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: The name Stanford comes originally from a stone ford across a local rivulet,the Hassen Brook.This was later replaced by a bridge.Le Hope refers to a large bend in the River Thames which occurs nearby and represented a safe haven for ships after the more exposed waters of the estuary. There is a record of the Manor of Hassingeburc in the Domesday Book.The Tenant-in-Chief was Bishop Odo,the half-brother of King William.It would appear that there were two manors,the other being the Manor of Stanford which was held by Waltham Abbey.Later the lands were divided into 3 manors, Hassingbrook,Cabourne's and Abbotts Hall. The 1851 Census tells us that the population of Stanford le Hope was 439.
